proof:
Proof. We show the lemma by induction on $t$. The case $t = 0$ is trivial.
If $v_i$ is dead in $G_{t'}$ for every $t' \in \text{rebuild}(t)$, where $t' \le t$, then $v_i$ is dead at time $t$ (note that by definition we always have $t \in \text{rebuild}(t)$). Also, in this case, $D[i]$ is not overwritten at time $t$. By Lemma 3 and the induction hypothesis, $D[i] = \tilde{d}^{t-1}(v_i) = \tilde{d}^t(v_i)$.
Otherwise, let $t'$ be the largest time less than or equal to $t$ in $\text{rebuild}(t)$ at which $v_i$ is alive. By definition of the algorithm, $D[i] = \tilde{d}^{t'}(v_i)$. If $t' = t$, then $D[i] = \tilde{d}^t(v_i)$, and if $t' < t$, then by definition of $t'$, $v_i$ is dead for any subsequent rebuild time in $\text{rebuild}(t)$. Since the set of dead nodes is guaranteed to be monotonically increasing between rebuilds, this implies $\tilde{d}^t(v_i) = \tilde{d}^{t'}(v_i)$.
